name: places/ChIJocz0DYFYwokR6DXBZRLzQJg
formattedAddress: 350 W 88th St, New York, NY 10024, USA
adrFormatAddress: 350 W 88th St, New York, NY 10024-2206, USA

editorialSummary.text: Budget rooms on quiet street have private baths, fridges, microwaves & free WiFi.

originalText.text: This hotel Is not worth it. The room is really small with pigeons outside my window make it hard to sleep at night because they make so much noise.  The bathroom seems to be renovated. College students live here for there housing, the college or university should find a better housing. There are bugs everywhere from very small to medium size, even if you clean and vacuum they will still appear. The kitchen for the floor is disgusting and looks like no one cleans up. Location is good near riverside park and many food places close by and the subway system is not far about 5 minute walk.

text.text: This hotel Is not worth it. The room is really small with pigeons outside my window make it hard to sleep at night because they make so much noise.  The bathroom seems to be renovated. College students live here for there housing, the college or university should find a better housing. There are bugs everywhere from very small to medium size, even if you clean and vacuum they will still appear. The kitchen for the floor is disgusting and looks like no one cleans up. Location is good near riverside park and many food places close by and the subway system is not far about 5 minute walk.

originalText.text:
For the price paid, it was a good hotel, in a great location.
I did not find the room too small, at least not compared to other rooms you would get in NYC or any big city around the world!
The hotel overall was clean and the rooms kept in a clean condition as well.
We left most of the times at around 9am and came back late at nights, so the most important thing for me was a good nights sleep and a shower in the mornings, both of these needs the hotel met.
Of course if you look for a fancy 5* hotel with different dining options, gym, spa and so on, this place won't be for you.
But for a first timer to New York who spents most of his/her time out and about this great city and wants to live in a true manhattan neigborhood and away from all the touristy craziness at times square, I can recommend this place.
The area in general was safe and only a few blocks to walk to the nearest subway station.

originalText.text: Don't live to X19 any floor, Winter cold summer hot. Fixed staff attitude is very rude. If you have a better choice, you can choose in a happy place. The most important thing is almost not see the sun all day in the room.

originalText.text: I stayed here in May 2014. I liked so much because is very close to 86th street subway station.

originalText.text:
Stayed here in May 2014 and was very satisfied.
Thinking about going back to NYC and this is the first and only place I am looking at.
